content.rendered:
Dreamforce 19 was amazing, wasn’t it? So much fun seeing so many Ohana, all the awesome sessions, cool announcements, Obama!!! But this year at Dreamforce, I was able to do something a little extra special, and decided to try to bring some Ohana together myself.

Knew before that planning things for Dreamforce must be stressful and crazy, you have all that anticipation of DF, there is all the scheduling for your trip,  plus the idea of trying to take on an event is intimidating, but with #OhanaSlack getting close to 3,000 members, I figured it was the least I could do this DF as my part to say thank you to the community.  With the help of some amazing Ohana, such as the awesome Michelle Hansen who was the most patient person ever helping with locations, we pulled it off!

On Thursday afternoon, we had the very first ever #OhanaSlack Ice Cream Social at Icicles, and it was fantastic!  People came through during the event, with Nathan Shulman as the first one there, followed by many more! Finally seeing those face to face you work with online so much is an awesome experience (Daniel Halley – was great to finally meet you for one example), as is catching up with old friends (like Chris Blahna and others ;-).  I want to say one more time (at least) thank you to all of you who helped and all who attended.  It was great being able to spend time with you!  Thank you so much for all you do to help others, including me, within the slack workspace, twitter, IRL, and more.

Looking forward to seeing you all again next year!

Join OhanaSlack: https://mrockssf.site/2ooiWPo

Chris Blahna

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce Events 2020
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The Salesforce Events 2020 is live!! That's right Ohana, it wouldn't be my blog if I wasn't talking about events and how we connect and get together as humans.  For real, we get out from behind the keyboard, and even leave the HOUSE!!! I know, it's crazy, but for Ohana,…
